channel.title: No clients working after Java 15 update
channel.description:
I had no problems with any clients until I updated both the jre and jdk to the latest update (15). I updated my Enviromental variables and everything as well.
I am able to load the client and get on the server, but after about 5-10 seconds of playing it will just exit, and in the cmd window it shows the errors for a split second but never long enought to make out what the error says. Does anyone have any ideas on what is causing this, or even heard of it before? I assume I am missing something right under my nose :mad:
Thanks in advance!

item.title: No clients working after Java 15 update

@k0_arch3rs wrote:

how do u change the variable?

item.title: No clients working after Java 15 update
item.dc:creator: @Scheer Scheer
item.description:
@Scheer wrote:

I went back to Java update 14 and still no luck. I changed the files to 14 and my variables as well.

I did find several other people are having this problem and they all have 64 bit systems. Here is the error:

at the end of the cmd code then tell us the error.

item.dc:creator: @Scheer Scheer
item.description:
@Scheer wrote:

Sorry forgot to put that in the first post…

Yeah I did, and I could be wrong, but if I didn’t then I wouldn’t be able to get on at all, right?

Because I can play for a few seconds, and if I spawn something and it closes, the next time I am on I will still have that item… so I know its saving. I really am lost here

item.title: No clients working after Java 15 update
item.dc:creator: @Scheer Scheer
item.description:
@Scheer wrote:

I had no problems with any clients until I updated both the jre and jdk to the latest update (15). I updated my Enviromental variables and everything as well.

I am able to load the client and get on the server, but after about 5-10 seconds of playing it will just exit, and in the cmd window it shows the errors for a split second but never long enought to make out what the error says. Does anyone have any ideas on what is causing this, or even heard of it before? I assume I am missing something right under my nose :mad:

Thanks in advance!

Read full topic
